item.title: Kenshi Abe (阿部 拳之)
item.description: About Me Welcome to my web page! My name is Kenshi Abe and I am a research scientist at CyberAgent, Inc., AI Lab. I am interested in reinforcement learning, imperfect-information games, and multi-agent learning. Research Interests Reinforcement Learning Multi-agent Reinforcement Learning Partially Observable Markov Decision Problems Imperfect Information Games E-mail abekenshi1224[at]gmail.com SNS Github Twitter LinkedIn Blog and Presentation Qiita Research Blog SlideShare

Research International Conference Kenshi Abe, Kaito Ariu, Mitsuki Sakamoto, Atsushi Iwasaki. A Slingshot Approach to Learning in Monotone Games ICML 2024. [paper] Yuu Jinnai, Tetsuro Morimura, Ukyo Honda, Kaito Ariu, Kenshi Abe. Model-Based Minimum Bayes Risk Decoding ICML 2024. [paper] Riku Togashi, Kenshi Abe, Yuta Saito. Scalable and Provably Fair Exposure Control for Large-Scale Recommender Systems WWW 2024. [paper] Hakuei Yamada, Junpei Komiyama, Kenshi Abe, Atsushi Iwasaki. Learning Fair Division from Bandit Feedback
